text: Blessed Is Everyone Who Fears Yahweh
A song of ascents.\f + \fr Ps 128 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Blessed \add is\add* everyone who fears Yahweh,
You will indeed eat of the labor of your hands;
you \add will be\add* happy and \add it will be\add* well with you.
Your wife \add will be\add* like a fruitful vine
⸤within⸥\f + \fr 128:3 \ft Literally “in the recesses of” \f* your house.
Your children\f + \fr 128:3 \ft Hebrew “sons” \f* \add will be\add* like olive shoots
Look, for thus shall a man be blessed
⸤who fears Yahweh⸥.\f + \fr 128:4 \ft Literally “a fearer of Yahweh” \f*
May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
that you may see the good of Jerusalem
all the days of your life,
and that you may see your children’s children.
